Even if the rest of the movie had been fantastic, the last 5 minutes would have still had people wishing for their money back.

Review title: Doesn't live up to the hype
Review_body: I had very high hopes for this movie. Maybe that lead to my opinion of the movie when it was over. First of all this movie should not be mention in the same breath as The Evil Dead, Texas Chainsaw, etc. It is an ok low budget horror movie at best.With that said there are a couple of things I did enjoy about Cabin Fever. I thought the acting of the five main people was pretty good for this type of movie. The premise was great, it was refreshing not to have teens running from masked killers with knives. I really liked the fact the movie did not tell you how the virus came about of where it came from. I think it is way better if you're in the dark having to guess about.However, I did not care for the script at all. I thought most of the dialouge seemed forced and mechanical. Also for all the "hype" about how much gore this movie had, I was greatly disappointed. I was hoping for Dead Alive gore and this movie did not deliver anything close to that at all. The worst thing about the movie was the secondary actors. Except for the guy who played the general store owner they were some of the worst actors ever filmed.In the end this is a good movie to rent if you've already seen Halloween, Evil Dead, Texas Chainsaw, Zombie, 28 Days Later, Dead Alive, Nightmare on Elm Street, John Carpenter's The Thing, Night of the Living Dead, Dawn of the Dead, Day of the Dead, Alien, American Werewolf in London, Dog Soldiers & The Blair Witch Project a hundred times...

the horror scene in the U.S. has been disappointing for the last couple decades, but Eli Roth is trying to change that. Cabin Fever brings us back to how horror movies used to be and it plays as a sort of homage to old school horror. You have the blood, the sex, the naked hot chick, the dumb jock, the cool guy, the awkward dorky guy, his love interest who doesn't notice his obvious interest, and the always popular rednecks with shotguns out to get you in the woods. With all these classic elements present, the movie still manages to put a new spin on things by introducing a flesh-eating virus into the story as well. This is a good movie and hopefully a start to having horror movies made the way they should be.

We all like horror movies right?  I pretty much go see anyone that comes out, love them.  Slasher flicks, suspense, Sci-Fi you name it.  There is generally a common thread amongst the really good ones, the villain, whether perceived or actual, is scary.  At first look this one has all the hints of a good movie; it has gore, hot chicks, guns, creepy woods, and even rednecks!  How can it go wrong you ask?  Well, it has no villain.  Just some contagious flesh eating virus.  Ooooo...  Cover my eyes, I can't watch.There are some ethical, samaritan implications to the characters in the movie, which is probably why the critics dug this movie.  But really I don't care, and I didn't care about the characters either.  There are some obvious comparisons to "28 Days Later...", but this movie never reached that level of spookdom.Catch this on a matinee, or wait for video.  Save your money for a horror movie that has actual horror.

Review title: This is what is wrong with Horror Films today **SPOILERS**
Review_body: This movie wasn't very good.  The characters were broad stereotypes who never broke out of their respective molds.  The writing was intended for an audience that wouldn't question what they were being fed.Just a hint to other posters here, but STEALING isn't paying homage to other films.I read a lot of "Evil Dead" comparisons on the comment page, and I saw NOTHING that compared to evil dead other than this mess of a movie took place in a cabin.  "Evil Dead" had great lines, sight gags and inventive camera work.  This movie had the "I'm gonna shoot gay squirrels" line and they even backpedaled from that!"Cabin Fever" didn't pay homage to previous horror films, it just blatantly ripped them off.  And it didn't even have the imagination to add a twist...it simply ripped off the ending of "The Night of the Living Dead."This is a medicore effort, but I suppose if you are hard up for horror and have VERY low standards, you might get some thrills out of it.  As for me, I thought this was a very poor written film and I wished I had not spent the money for the discount matinee I saw it at.

Review title: I cannot believe this was released.
Review_body:
This is nearly the worse movie I have ever forced myself to sit through. I cannot believe it has an above average rating on this data base. This movie is so bad, it encouraged me to register to state my opinion.
The movie starts slow, and slows down from there. The only thing that even came close to being entertaining was seeing a former power ranger naked, and a joke from a store clerk.it was silly, there was no plot to speak of and was missing a major component of a horror film, you didn't care one way or another whether the stars lived or died.be warned, do not waste your money on this flick.

I've been reading a lot of the user comments and it seems that 90 percent of people are completely clueless about this movie.  Eli Roth is making fun of horror movies, not trying to make the next "Halloween."  In fact, I think this movie is better than any of the "Scary Movie" films, as Roth mixes in the humor with an actual horror story.  If you can't see this from the abundance of jokes and the hilarious ending, than I feel sorry for your stupidity.  Great job Eli Roth and I can't wait for the dvd of "The Rotten Fruit" to come out.

Appalling acting, appalling script, A film that has no direction The story makes no sense The plot holes are enormous The reasons for the characters actions is beyond belief How anyone can say it's good is beyond me don't waste your time on this pile of crap, you`ll thank me for it Don't waste your money buying it Don't waste your money renting it The End

The single worst movie I have ever seen in my life, no question. Everything was just terrible with this flick. I have never felt more violently angry after watching a movie than I did with this. What an absolute waste of my life. I was trying to make the movie a joke, laughing at the hokey storyline as if it was a parody, but the fact that this worthless tool of a director acutally thought he really made something to be proud of... well... I am dumbfounded... how unbearable that this no-talent hack could get funding and great camera's to shoot this piece of kindling and there are so many more with talent, how unbearable. I hate this, I hate this, I hate this, I hate this, I hate this, I hate this, I HATE THIS MOVIE AND EVERYONE INVOLVED

Review title: Every copy in the world should be broken in half and burned
Review_body: Me and my cousin went into Movie Gallery and he got this and we expected something decent....I knew it was going to have blood and gore in it....but it was so ridiculous....the cursing ruined the movie....every other word was the F word and it sounded so lame.....there was no point....a bunch of people go camping and die from a flesh-eating disease....I didn't get whether the end was supposed to be funny or horrific.....to me it was neither....words can't describe how bad this movie was. It was the most awful excuse for a film that has ever been my disgrace to lay my eyes upon....please don't watch this waste of time, money, energy, and oxygen....why was this ever released anyway? It's movies like this that ruin people's lives....and I DON'T mean by scaring them to deathScary? nope Good story? nope Good acting? nope Should be kicked off the shelves? yepDon't watch this movie and make the same mistake I did.....don't make a decision you'll regret....Listen I would give this movie and negative number if I couldAll in all, this movie is just gross, not scary.....so please trust me and stay away from it....maybe if it stops selling they'll get rid of it

This movie was absolutely terrible. I am a movie lover, and I have seen hundreds of films, and this is the only one I can truly say was awful. The virus thing has been done well before, but this was not done well. You knew that it was only a matter of time before they all had the virus. There was no loophole, no way they could avoid it. Therefore, the suspense lay in waiting to see how they realised it, and how gruesome it was.***** SPOILERS *****Now, don't get me wrong, I'm a fan of gruesome killings, but not this. I mean, come on? You're watching her shave her legs. Watching her shave her legs. You know that the razor's going to take off her flesh. You know it's going to happen. She's still shaving normally.... AAAAH... not. Everything was done for gore and shock factor, and not one thing gave me a real scare.However, there was one thing that I did enjoy, and that was the ending. The fact that the guys who simply killed the remaining kids, rather than trying to help them, then dumped the bodies - (very carelessly, I might add. They could have got the clever ones, who realised that dumping a contagious body in a source for drinking water is a no-no, but instead, they get the stupid ones to dump the body) - will now get the disease, and it will spread everywhere, is a very ironic, funny and clever ending.However, it's the only ironic, funny and clever thing in this whole movie. I may also have seen it as the best bit because the movie did, in fact, end. My advice, unless you are a fan of gratuitous gore, very little plot, and no suspense (apart from waiting to see how the next oozing bloody wound will manifest itself) then avoid it. Or just watch the last fifteen minutes. You'll get the overall point of the movie, and the best bit, all in one.

This film has been unfairly judged! It is in fact a very good 80's style, Splatter, B-movie. It shys away from the self referencing humor plague that Scream started and succeeds in being a very strange splatter/comedy. Several reviews have been posted that say the characters are unlikable and do illogical things through the course of the movie. The characters are very good representations of the youth of the late 90's. The hunting squirrels joke is a perfect example. When asked why he is hunting the squirrels, the character replies, "Cause their gay". How many times have you heard a teen respond to a question in such a manner? Eli Roth has captured very well the essence of of being a teenager in this very cynical society.The actions the characters take are, in context, very believable. Ask yourself, if you were in a situation where you had to deal with the very likely possibility of becoming infected with a horrible flesh-eating disease, would you be the first to lend a helping hand to the infected? Another thing that has been trashed by many reviews is the strange sense of humor the film has. The pancakes scene in particular. The humor in the film is the strange sort you would more likely find in a Troma film (not the sex/toilet variety, though)While it's not for everyone, the sense of fun the movie has about itself is more suited to hardcore B-movie fans than mainstream audiences. Eli Roth hearkens back to a time when movies weren't always about psychological thrills,bad twist endings, and pretentious artistic "meanings", when they were about fun. It's a great movie to sit around with some friends and watch. So please, don't judge it so harshly, just because it's a movie to be taken straight with no shocking hidden meanings or twists. Hopefully this film will find it's audience with the cult movie crowd. Highly recommended to anyone with a love of B-Movie cinema.

Review title: I'm sorry but i love this movie!
Review_body: This has to be one of the funniest most original horror films that I have ever seen! I own this title and i've seen it about 4 times, and every time i'm like "i forgot how much i love this movie!". However if you like traditional slasher horror movies this might seem kind of lame. I kind of think most horror movies are lame so.....I'm not even a fan of Eli Roth's other movies. I rarely give movies 10 stars and i'm not doing it to boost the overall rating. This movie just has some kind of special quality to it. I would say more but i don't want to do any spoiling. I hope that people will give this movie a chance and not expect anything in particular from it

Review title: the classic cabin in the woods
Review_body: But now with viruses and some good looking young people getting chomped from the inside.

I had high hopes for this movie. But, alas, it disappointed. The story begins, much as many others, featuring teens in the woods, so we already know this isn't going to touch on anything new. But, very soon, the action, and gore, become secondary, as the characters go out of their way to do the most ridiculous, and unrealistic, things. Of course, this being a horror film (or at least attempting to be one), the unrealistic is common. However, films such as "Evil Dead" and especially the recent update of "Dawn of the Dead", have proved how well a film with an initially clichéd storyline, can be woven into a classic. Unfortunately this film has not, opting instead to go with cheap shocks, mundane special effects, and incredibly wooden acting.

Review title: Please, Don't Take This Film Seriously
Review_body: Eli Roth is shaping up to be the Kevin Smith of horror films.Mr. Roth, an admitted fan of the genre since he was 8, has shaped his passion for gore flicks into Cabin Fever, a lopsided tribute to the senseless violence and campy thrills of the horror movies of the 70s and 80s.Cabin Fever is his first attempt at a mainstream film. Note: FIRST ATTEMPT.There's nothing in this film that sets one up to believe that this is a serious attempt at horror. In fact, each character is a staple of the horror community. Horny couple? Check. Drunk ignorant party-animal? Check. Clean-cut All-American Boy (Rider Strong, from Boy Meets World)? Check. All-American Boy's secret love interest? Check. Lots of bizarre in-bred rural-types? Checkity-check-check-check.Roth shares his love of bad horror with us via Cabin Fever. All he really needed was the three B's (beer, blood, and breasts), and he delivered in spades. Except for that third one. There wasn't enough of that. Bad Eli. No cookie.Cabin Fever is your basic toss-back-a-few-beers-and-enjoy-the-ride type of film. It only requires enough cognitive function to operate a DVD player. If you're looking for depth, extensive character development, and well-written drama, you're looking in the wrong section of the video rental store.This is also very NOT for the family. As with Kevin Smith, the language is quite riddled with expletives. If it's ever edited to air on network TV, expect it to run about an hour shorter. Of course, Mr. Roth, ever thoughtful of his audience, does include a "family version" of the film on the DVD. It's a must-watch. It's also quick.This film is a tribute to cheese. 100% Grade-A American cheese, to be precise. While I'm certain that Eli Roth has a classic in horror within him, just waiting to erupt, I'm equally certain that he didn't intend this to be it. Just be patient.

OK let's get right to the point. We have five recent college grads (must have majored in the F word) going out on a weekend camping trip. They run into someone who is in need of help, but instead of trying to assist him, they decide to set him on fire instead. Nice bunch of people. Next some of them start go get sick - must be something in the water at the cabin they are staying at. However the neighbors seem to be OK. Oh well, when things start getting really bad, they lock up one their companions instead of getting help (try the neighbor by the way). Some locals don't take a liking to them. They chase one on a high speed romp through the woods for many miles, until the truck breaks down. Somehow ten minutes later he shows up at the cabin (how he could find it and how he could travel at the speed of light to get there is a mystery). Another of the brain surgeon type at the cabin realizes something is amiss so he hides out in a cave to let this blow over. He then decides the next day to return to the cabin believing it must be some type of shrine. He is giddy with relief that he survived (he must have thought it was a 24 hour bug). Unfortuneatley he is met by some not so friendly police officers. Another couple decide to have sex while the flesh eating bug is working its magic, and then the women realizes she needs to shave her legs (taking a lot of the diseased skin with shaving cream). Anyway you get the idea. Nothing makes sense here. These are five people I would not want to be friends with. I was rooting for the flesh eating bacteria. Other characters were introduced who were also somewhat amusing but utterly unlikeable as well. Ninety minutes of good life wasted here.

Review title: Catch the cabin fever and you'll get a few hours of fun!
Review_body: I'm wondering how people can hate this movie?When I was on my way to order this movie,one friend told me:''Please,don't buy that movie,it's awful!'' I decided to buy it,because I wanted to see if he's right.When I saw the movie,I was shocked!Fever,which has come into these people on very unusual way,totally freaked me out!I couldn't believe that someone can have so sick ideas for movie like this.And,I like sick things.Horror is genre of the movie which has to scare and fright people!I don't like horror movies that are very passive and that doesn't have a point.But,boy,this movie has a point...And it has a very good point!Really,is it possible to catch the fever?Of course it is.So,this can be very possible in the real life and that is something that scares me a lot.I also like movies with zombies,unreal creatures,but also I know the doesn't exist.But the fever does,so...?I hope you can understand me.This movie is very sick (in right meaning of that word) and I loved it! I give this movie 9/10 because there are some things that I didn't like too much.But,disregard this,the movie rocks!

There is nothing - and I mean NOTHING - of interest in this "film" for anyone who truly enjoys a good horror film. The TV ads are stuffed with raves from Peter Jackson, which should be good for box office. But having now seen this mess I feel I must ask: Is Peter Jackson related in any way to Susan Jackson the executive producer? If not then I'm baffled how someone who made a classic such as Dead Alive could see anything of merit in this remedial effort.Rent Manos, the Hands of Fate instead and feel secure in the knowledge that, as bad as it is, it's better than Cabin Fever.

Cabin Fever, without a doubt, is within the top five of my list of all time worst movies.  When I left the theater I was actually insulted by the making of this gigantic hunk of crap.  The only redeeming part of the entire movie was when the credits rolled at the end.With no plot, a let-down at every turn, and acting that was itself a joke, Cabin Fever was nothing more than a studio's attempt at seeing how many people it could sucker into the theater on opening weekend.  There is no way I could, with a clear conscience, recommend even watching a trailer for this move.

Seriously, this flick is just gross.  It's not scary or thrilling at all. I love me some horror movies, and I don't mind gore, but this was just icky. I just wanted to take a shower the whole time I was watching it.  Or if I could have had some of that sanitizer gel in my purse, that would have been great.There wasn't anyone who was really likable, and they all pretty much deserved to die.  I want my $7 dollars back so I can go see Cold Stone Manor this weekend.

Review title: Possibly the worst movie I have ever seen...
Review_body: After watching this movie, I wanted to ask the video store for my money back. I now judge other movie's by how badly this one sucked. i.e "Well, it was better than Cabin Fever." Lame effects, bad acting, weak story... The trailer for the movie is better than the actual film itself. It gave the impression of suspense... That the movie was going to be somewhat psychological. The only thing I was on the edge of my seat for was the moment the credits would roll, and as far as psychological goes... You may need psychological help after viewing it. If you are a fan of B Horror, you might think it was OK. As my score shows, it's worse than B in my book.

Review title: Awful...I want my money and my wasted time back.
Review_body: This was far and away one of the worst movies I have ever seen (and believe me, I see a lot of movies). The plot was ridiculous, the acting sub par, and the scares non-existent. I really feel that Eli Roth, the cast, and everyone involved in the making of "Cabin Fever" owe me $9 and 93 minutes of my life back. It might have been tolerable if they decided to camp it up, but they took it all so seriously. They couldn't decided on a consistent tone and it was not scary AT ALL. They just threw around a bunch of blood and gore in place of coming up with involving characters or story. On top of everything else, this movie seemed to have no interest in facts or logic. As a scientist, I can tell you that their handling of the disease was completely off base.

yes, my summary says it all! When i decided to watch it, it was because of all the hype and reviews 'terrifying!' said one review. well whoever said that must p*** himself when someone says 'boo', cos cabin fever was one of the worst films i have ever seen. the other comments of this film in this forum have said it's a copy of other horror movies, it's badly done, and it ruined it's potential with unrealistic scenes and weak characters- well guess what? I agree! i sat down expecting a scary disturbing film- what did i get- a load of sh**, that's what. the concept is quite scary (some teenagers in a cabin in the middle of nowhere, being killed off by a flesh eating virus) but it was handled really badly. the films humour is NOT humorous, and worse, it's inappropriate. also, the characters keep making stupid irrational actions, which are unrealistic even if your in a panic. i kept thinking about what it would have been like done well, and it makes me feel disappointed. this Eli Roth needs shooting. 'hostel' a newer horror movie by Eli Roth, again, like cabin fever, looked great, but i'm told it's sh** (i'll have to see it myself). so it seems Eli Roth makes up (or steals) brill horror ideas and then makes a mockery of them. i wish i'd been given the chance to make cabin fever. however, there was one bit that i liked. it's the bit when that blond women is making love to that guy (the more friendly couple out of the teens)and there's that really euphoric sweet music, and then... well i won't spoil it, but it's quite horrific, and it did make me feel quite sad, because they had a closer relationship than the brunette woman and the other guy. and there's the bit with the woman who looks like a skeleton cos of the virus- that was sort of horrific. the ending had quite a good twist, but it was done poorly, which made it absolutely rubbish. see for fun, not to be scared. guess i'll have to carry on my fruitless search to find a 'SCARY' horror film...

Review title: Hope you're not looking for horror
Review_body: The first five minutes of this movie showed potential. After that, it went straight from something possibly decent to some sort of illegitimate comedy. The best part is that I couldn't stop thinking of Supertroopers thanks to Joey Kern. I would recommend watching this movie for the sheer fact of learning how not to make a movie. There are so many scenes in this movie that makes one just stop and wonder if the entire cast and crew just stopped caring at some point. The thing that amazes me most about this movie is that it grossed $22 million in the box office and only cost about $1.5 million to make. Congrats to Lion's Gate for being able to pull that one off.

Review title: Disappointing would be the only word to describe this movie
Review_body: I saw previews for this movie when it came out and it genuinely looked good but at the time I wasn't old enough to see it in theaters, so when it came out on video I decided to rent it. BIG mistake, I'm not really sure if it was supposed to be a horror movie or a comedy. Its the story of 5 friends who go camping in the woods after finals and they catch this flesh eating virus that kills them. This movie lacked substance and special effects the gore wasn't "gory" it just looked like bad make up. The only remotely interesting part was when the kid screams out "PANCAKES!" and that's not saying much. The acting was sub par, this should have been a straight to video movie. Bottom line don't waste you're money renting it, just watch it at 3 a.m. when nothing else is on TV.

Review title: If you like your horror films over-rated and pointless...
Review_body: then this is the film for you!  Get on the hype train and ride this ingratiating film to its boring conclusion.I swear the director went out of his way to watch all the greatest horror films made in the last 40 years and then proceeded to remember none of it.The only thing scary about this film is that people have liked it, people call it a horror film, and that the director will go on to make another film.Not since "Pieces" has their been a more pointless martial arts scene.You've been warned - Cabin Fever has characters out of a bad David Lynch film who would never be friends, no action, no idea of location, zero scares, and a talented DP.Cabin Fever is easily the worst straight to video film that somehow got projected since "Jason Takes Manhattan."Consider yourself warned...

no redeeming qualities can possibly be expressed. i wish i could get my time back. nice skull face broad really smiles, bright at the camera when the disease has already wreaked enough havoc on the ill informed script. i was ((spoiler)) happy to see all the characters dead or severely incapacitated by the end, especially the party poopers that drink the tainted juice on their way to the alleged sunset. Eli Roth does shine for moments of maybe ten, putting forth the theory on how well weed smokes in the woods when others really fiend on top of beer consumption. overall, i found most of it pointless, though not without gratuitous violence and not enough nudity, happy to witness the demise of cast, in a way though, wishing that journey never happened (probably should've been getting laid instead of watching TBS late night, ugh).

Review title: Try hard college student makes movie.
Review_body: When a director tries to make a cult classic, it is indeed a sad affair. This movie is one of the stupidest most pretentious movies I have ever seen in my life. And I have watch millions of movies. Don't go see this movie you will be wasting your time, I found nothing amusing let alone scary about it. I found the homage factor to other movies, shameful, and boring. The whole movie was cheap college Junk rapped in pretentious direction.Overall:Try hard college student makes movie. Junk rapped in pretentious direction.

So, when I first heard of Cabin Fever, it had just come out on DVD, and my idiot neighbor described the plot to me. Being a nine-year old hypochondriac, I was absolutely terrified and refused to shower for weeks. The plot line of the movie continued to haunt me throughout the years. Fast forward to October '07. I was watching 30 Scarier Movie Moments on Bravo, when they proceeded to discuss the scene in which Marcy shaves the diseased skin off of her legs. I flipped out, turned off the TV, and called my boyfriend, at the time, sobbing. I'm not usually scared of things, but the reminder of my 9 year old trauma managed to do so. Being a slight sadist and a mass opportunist, he, of course, made me watch the movie when it came on Sci-Fi a week later.Upon seeing the movie, I laughed like a brain dead hyena, and felt undeniably stupid. I had, up until then, never seen anything so ridiculous. Cabin Fever is chock full of terrible, stolen horror movie gimmicks, useless characters, interchangeable comments, plot holes galore, and predictable, unneeded plot twists, giving you the feeling almost of a Family Guy spoof. It ranked up there with Friday the 13th in the unintelligent-to-the-point-of-vomit-horny teen-meets-machete category. The only moment in which the movie felt scary is the opening credits, where the sound of flies buzzing as the background color changes from parchment white to a bloody red, imitating the virus at work. The horror in that, and that scene alone, is infallible. Yet, the rest of the movie's ill-combined efforts to shock, disturb, humor, and arouse the audience fall flatter than the beloved pancakes of the redneck Karate Kid. For me, some of the king making scenes of Cabin Fever have to be when Paul and Marcy infect each other, almost deliberately, by sleeping together, accompanied by the ingenious line "You just want to grab the person next to you and ****, since you know you're gonna die anyway," and when an infected, well- shaved Marcy is torn apart afterward by a hungry dog for idiotically running away from the cabin two feet away towards a LOCKED shed to escape. And then, if that isn't enough, the dog tore her to shreds, leaving a foot intact. Last I checked, dogs were incapable of eating my skeletal system. Unrealistic, obvious, and just plain stupid.All in all, Cabin Fever is a worthless piece of garbage that is funny for all the wrong reasons. But if you're a masochist like me, you might enjoy the obvious deaths these stupid college kids endure every time you pop in the DVD. Seriously, it's funnier than Scary Movie could hope to achieve, folks. And yet they're actually trying to scare you.

Review title: The WORST movie I've ever seen in my entire life!
Review_body: I've rented and watched this movie for the 1st time on DVD without reading any reviews about it. So, after 15 minutes of watching I've noticed that something is wrong with this movie; it's TERRIBLE! I mean, in the trailers it looked scary and serious!I think that Eli Roth (Mr. Director) thought that if all the characters in this film were stupid, the movie would be funny...(So stupid, it's funny...? WRONG!) He should watch and learn from better horror-comedies such as:"Fright Night", "The Lost Boys" and "The Return Of the Living Dead"! Those are funny!"Cabin Fever" is THE reason why I registered to www.IMDb.com so I can release my thoughts of discontent about it.I've decided to watch the movie a second time >AAARGH!< and make notes for my partial "review" to show how foolish the movie is. "Resident Evil" (horror) or "Dude, Where's My Car?" (comedy) I can watch over and over again and still enjoy! But this...!How bad can a script and a director be??? This bad. Here are the awful scenes in chronological order:In the early scenes we see Henry, who doesn't realize his dog lying on the ground with its tongue hanging out of its mouth and dead-glazed stare is dead!The movie doesn't explain anything about the blonde long-haired kid who like to bite people.And my answer to Marcy's unanswered question ("What's wrong with the woods?") is "nothing". The script has that bearded guy warn them about the woods just for "suspense".Then the "smartest" of the 5-pack, Bert, almost gives us an example of how to start a forest fire. He meets now-infected Henry who begs for help and from here on the movie wants to break the record in using the "F-word". Bert starts to freak out because Henry looks awfully ill. Bert:"Don't make me shoot you!" (he forgets to add: "...with my BB gun!")Bert heads back to the cabin but how about that? He meets Marcy and Jeff who were having sex, but now suddenly decide to go out for a walk! Marcy wisely takes out the unguarded campfire Bert had started earlier (A moment of clarity for a change?) Bert doesn't mention a word about Henry because the fool thinks he has killed him with his BB gun.Later, as the Five Estupidos sit around their campfire, another weirdo shows up with his dog. (Maybe that's what the warning about the woods is all about? It's filled with weirdos...and their dogs!?) They let him sit with them only because he has a huge bag filled with cannabis. (Their brains are completely intoxicated! No wonder why they are all so DUMB!) This is the last time we'll see this forgettable character...alive!Henry shows up at their cabin, (NOTE: He was lying all the time a few yards from their cabin!!!) looking worse, almost like a zombie, covered in goo! He says he needs a doctor. But the Young Einsteins refuse to help the poor sucker. He gets into their unlocked truck which of course also has its key in the ignition. Henry almost seems smart enough to drive the Hell away from there but instead starts puking blood all over the dashboard, seats and windows. The Fantastic Five come out running, armed with: a BB Gun, a knife, a baseball bat (*huh? Ever tried playing baseball in the middle of the woods???), a poker, and a (insecticide?) spray-can, ready to combat the single, unarmed and terribly sick man. (clever script!) Bert manages to kill the car with one single shot of his BB Gun, which is only possible in the mind of director Eli Roth. "What else am I supposed to do?" Bert yells in his defense. Jeff and Paul try to knock Henry down with their bat and poker but miss and crash the truck's windows instead. Henry walks up to the dumb girls who say: "He's coming towards us!" (Thanks for the info, dumb broads, I can see that! But I don't think he wants to do you any harm!) Marcy sprays in his eyes, making Henry yelp! And our "hero" Paul touches Henry's arm with a burning log from the campfire, which they recklessly left burning while they were INSIDE the cabin! (Where has all that wisdom gone? I guess the cannabis had started to take its toll!:-) Henry turns into The Human Torch and runs away, screaming.The following day, Bert and Jeff head out for a mechanic. And Marcy decides to "go for help" all by herself, in the woods, as Paul stays behind with Karen...Doesn't that sound idiotic? Marcy could have stayed with Karen and Paul because Jeff and Bert were already "going for help"!I skip my comments now to how we suddenly see Marcy in a CANOE rowing over a huge and winding river! How did she get a canoe? Does she even know where she's going!? Anyway, she goes to the riverbank and finds a very big and seemingly abandoned cabin and, like in most horror movies, walks inside the cabin saying:"Hello? Is anyone there?" Bert suddenly pops up from behind a furniture and scares her (and me at first). And along comes Jeff, as well. How did THEY get here!? Did they swim across the river??? Do you see how brainless the script is!?Deputy Winston meets Paul at the cabin. He somehow doesn't notice the blood on their truck. This happens around 35 minutes of viewing and I have decided to stop torturing myself anymore and popped the DVD out. (Before I take my own eyes out!...Now, THAT's funny!)If you liked this movie, do yourself a favor and watch "Fright Night", "The Lost Boys", or "The Return of The Living Dead". Then you'll see they are MORE entertaining than this...thing. Even the "Toxic Avenger part 2", which is also a lousy film, is way MORE funnier than "Cabin Fever".

This is the most enjoyable horror movie ive seen since Evil Dead, it has blood guts girls comedy and best of all rider strong who was sean in boy meets world he totally rocks in this movie and hope to see him in scavanger hunt. I am 16 years old and would also like to make a movie as bad ass as this one was. thanks 4 the movie Eli

I want to sue Eli Roth for the 95 minutes of my life he cheated me out of. Points that need addressing:1. Where is the explanation of where the virus came from?2. Why were other people not effected by virus. Don't they drink or use water?3. Why when the blonde tart first contracts the virus did they not walk to the neighbours house with her. She could still walk4. Why the hell am I bothering to discuss this film any further?One good thing I noticed, several songs taken from 'The Last House On The Left' which is and always will be a PROPER horror film.

Review title: WHAT THE HECK IS THE MATTER WITH YOU PEOPLE!!!
Review_body: Ok, so this movie wasn't Night of the Living Dead, Evil Dead, or TCM, but for this day and age, this is about as close as anyone making films has the guts to do, aside from Rob Zombie.  You people who are knocking this probably think Scream & I know What You Did Last Summer are good "Horror" movies....and to that I say NOT!!  Those movies SUCK!!!!  Come on people; have you all forgotten the great horror movies from the 80's and 70's? Those were truly horror movies.  Today, film makers try and try again to make movies that don't offend mom or dad, and call them horror movies!  At least Eli Roth has stuck to the theory that there doesn't need to be an in depth storyline, plot, or solid character development when all of the character are gonna die anyway!!!!  He just dealt with the mass hysteria of what happens when there is a disease that is killing your friends and you don't want to get it!  Good lord, I bet all you people knocking this don't even appreciate the Evil Dead Trilogy!!!  I bet if ya'll watched them, you'd be like this sucks and stuff when to the contrary they are some of the best genre movies of ALL time!!!!!It just never ceases to amaze me when I go catch a good horror flick, then come here and read all the reviews repeatedly bashing it.I think all ya'll that think this one sucked need to get a membership to NetFlix, and catch up on REAL HORROR MOVIES!!!!!

I love horror and Gory movies. But this one was awfull. I can't beleive I wasted my Saturday night and my money on this Crap. No time in this movie did it ever make sense. Where did the sickness originate from, Grim, WHY? No cure, no explanation, nothing. I almost fell asleep, But then, It get's good. YEAH RIGHT. It starts to get going then it just stops. What a waste of time. The movie "They", and "Battlefield Earth" are like Best Picture nomanies compared to this. I HATE IT. I want my 2 hours back.

Review title: At first I disliked it, Watch more than once and you realize that it is brilliant!!
Review_body: This is one of the movies that requires more than one viewing to understand the brilliance behind it. Listen to the commentary of the director, it is hilarious! I don't know if he realizes it but the line stroke after stroke in the shaving of the legs scene in commentary is intentionally or not, funny as hell. I have always been a horror movie fan, as is the director, Obvious upon viewing. This director is destined to great things and well deserved. This is only my second review, I only write when I feel strongly upon a subject. This film needs more than one viewing to appreciate it, the not in your face underlining humor! I wish the director much luck in the future, he didn't quit. I wish I had it in me to have followed my dreams like the director has (I think at 41 it is to late, to start over) . Do yourself a favor watch the movie repeated times to appreciate its true brilliance. It is amazing how you dislike a movie at first and then watch again and see the underlying brilliance. Don't miss this gem!!!!

I must have missed the promotion campaign around this movie, I went in without any expectations. I found myself holding my hand in front of my mouth throughout the movie, it was so disgustingly well done! I think I heard some people toss their cookies in the theatre :) The special effects and atmosphere redeem any fault to the plot (Where did the virus/bacteria/plague come from, what's the story behind the hillbillies/strange child, there was more potential here) Also the acting held up for the whole cast, compared to half the other teen-horror movies around. I wouldn't mind sequel (Maybe with the new visitors from the ending?)7/10 Grosss!!

Those of you that have seen both of these movies will know what I mean when I say they are too simliar for it to be a coincident.  Both are about remote locations and extreme cases of violence and murder.  The thing that I find most simliar is the tone and style in which the murder is presented.  The movies also show what happens when normal people meet extreme situations. The music is also very simliar as it is almost ticking away at disaster. The movie also does what few movies of quality have the gonads to do, they end the movie without a point being made.  Movies are meant to entertain while some do educate or provoke discusion some just have no point and were never meant too.  The only meaning I see from  both movies is that when we are in stressful situations it cause us to do the wrong thing.

All I can say was that the kid at the convenience store was..... What was his purpose?  The movie was great up until that point.  He just jumped off the porch and started yelling about Pancakes and doing Matrix stuff!  It was so stupid and pointless.  Everyone I've talked to about the movie brought that up.  It was useless and the movie stunk after that.

This movie was beyond gross. I can handle some levels of gross, but this had some truly disturbing parts. It left images in my head that pop up out of nowhere and creep me out. I gave this movie a 5 out of 10 because the plot wasn't even that substantial. I wasn't impressed enough for the grossness to be worth it.

Review title: With 20 miutes to go in the movie, I was laughing out loud at how bad it was...
Review_body: This was advertised as a thriller/horror film and I am always game for a movie like that.  I don't care what it was supposed to be, it was a miserable pile of crap.  There was no character development and even fewer scares.  If I ever went camping with friends like that, I would expect nothing less than to end up dead in the woods.  Forget the unbelievability of the movie, the thrills and chills were just not there.  I don't know what the makers of the movie were trying to accomplish, but they have me completely amazed that I actually spent money to watch this filth.

this movie has to be the WORST movie i have ever seen. i have seen almost every movie that has come out, and when i went to see this movie i expected to be scared and enjoy it. but instead i was bored for the whole 2hrs and however many minuets. my boyfriend came with me and half way thru the movie he started insisting that we leave. but i made him stay hoping that it would get better but what happened???? the movie got worse i new with in the first 45 seconds, (including the introduction) that it was going to be awful.. the only part of the movie i enjoyed were the trailers that played prior to the showing. if i could give anyone good advise this would be it.. do NOT GO TO THIS MOVIE, it has to be the worst movie made in the past 40 years... please take my advise dont go see this...

Abominable.  Assinine.  Awful.  A complete waste of time and money. Why didn't this go straight to video?  (and I mean Beta) Boring.  An extremely poor example of film making in every sense. This movie started off poor, and degenerated from there. Inconsistent.  Insipid.  Idiotic.  I wouldn't wish this movie on UBL, Saddam, or Hillary Clinton. Even with this current trend of offering up such completely useless excuses for exposing the public to some juvenile hacks idea of entertainment, one could hardly be prepared for 'Cabin Fever'. Acting?  Poor. Directing?  Very poor. Story?  Extemely poor. Cinematography?  Worse than "extremely poor". How this movie was ever produced will remain a mystery.  Like non-alcoholic beer and courduroy shorts. This was a horror pic alright, but probably not as it was intended. Now excuse me while I barf at the mere thought if this movie.

Review title: If you like horror and fun check this one out!
Review_body: I don't understand why people are so critical of this film. There are countless tributes to older horror films, and it brings back a certain light heartedness and fun to horror films that have been absent for years. The gore factor is unbelievably superior to any film in the past 5 years. The important thing to remember though is that this movie was not made to compete with other films for best picture. The director (whose appearance in the film should clue you in that hes not taking too much serious ) is not making a film to bend your mind or scare you more than any other film, he is just trying to make you have some fun. Which many of you obviously never do considering your opinions on this movie. Just remember the film is called Cabin Fever and it has a member from Boy Meets World in it. It is not supposed to be "Citizen Kane". Overall i rate it an 8/10!

As i Stated earlier it was the worst 90 minutes of my life.  The sad is i could have watched astroturf grow and had more fun..................Directly after the film,(the term and all definitions of film being used loosly) I tried to come up with other films that Cabin fever could be catagorized with and only two came to mind(the Majestic and of course Mr.Magoo).  That's when I knew that I really should check out the "star power" in any movie that I think might be a justified way to spend 7 bucks.

I hope nobody gets mad about my comments on this movie ,but I have to let my feelings out .This flim was not good at all.I dont want to get blacklist for telling the truth about this film ,but it was so bad I allmost couldnt finsh the film.It was more funny then scary.I hope theres not a number two Cabin Fever ,because the first one was horrible. Thank You, Debbie

Review title: Nothing but an excuse for pointless, tasteless violence.
Review_body: Will a good horror movie ever be made again? Judging by this worthless effort; unlikely.This film stands along side Final Destination 2 as the worst film I can ever recall seeing.The acting was mediocre, the plot virtually non existant and it is not at all genuinely scary. Simply subjecting the audience to endless gruesome special effects, 'blood, guts and gore,' is simply revolting, over the top and nothing more. These things are only there as an attempt to compensate for a shallow, pointless movie. It was boring, repetitive and the characters were so awful that I cannot see anyone caring what happens to them. I couldn't wait for them to be killed off, mainly just to get the film over with! The next time I make such a mistake I will simply walk out. Do not waste your money on this movie.Inevitably though, there are many who will no doubt like this film for most of the reasons I detest it. If you actually liked Final Destination 2 then you will probably appreciate this!Mercy!

This is one of those cases were the hype that precedes a movie causes people to lose their individuality. It is as if people try to find something good about this movie in case they have missed something that 'industry types' saw. Do not be fooled by the bidding frenzy; this is crap. David Lynch took his name off because it was crap not the lame story that it would negatively impact on the director. I can only hope that the pairing of Donnie Darko director, Richard Kelly, for Eli Roth's next project can inject intelligence into this childish mind. Roth claimed he was trying to inject life back into the old slashers but he has only put the genre back two decades while the Japanese and Koreans rush ahead with intelligence, humour and vigour. And he needs to get out more if he thinks there is no sex in horror movies. His sense of self importance is so appalling that suggesting his movie has any merit is akin to suggesting PeeWee Herman is a great comic. Maybe it is indicative of the inability of the average American to understand subtlety and intelligence.

Review title: Not as scary as I'd hoped
Review_body: Well, this movie was not at all good, but it wasn't really bad, either. The plot was OK and kept you wondering who may die next.  However, I was expecting a more "scary" scary movie...instead it was a pseudo-gore fest, and comedic portrayal of Rednecks in the woods.  I suppose the film lost all hope when *****SPOILER***** the main male character turned "postal" and seemed to stop worrying about who he killed next.  I guess the best part of the movie was the very end when we finally get the comment about the "gun" and who it was for...and that yummy lemonade!!

Review title: Clever Slasher Flick, Doesn't Follow General Formula
Review_body: Eli Roth uses clever techniques to produce a picture called Cabin Fever that brings about a fear of a flesh-eating disease that the kids catch throughout the movie. The characters are done quite well, the standout though is Rider Strong with this big-screen performance as the helpless-hero. The twists and turns this movie brings the audience through very much help the idea of the virus having a life and being able to influence others. Eli Roth did a great job with this film and this picture should not be missed by fans of great clever horror films that don't follow the general formula.

Half the time we were laughing, half the time we were going, "Ew."  There was no fear here.  The gore effects were awesome, if you're into horror FX, but I wouldn't say this movie was scary.  You barely cared about anybody in the movie and, in fact, most of the people, we openly wished would die painfully soon.  We kept wondering if it was a black comedy, but it missed the mark about 60% of the time.  Bottom line?  If you want to see something gross and halfway funny, watch this.  Want to watch a scary virus movie? Try 28 Days Later.

Review title: Oh please, is this a parody?
Review_body: I get so sick of these stupid movies. This is like a parody. These kids just can't get any more stupid. Why can't you try to make a movie where you don't need to build up the excitement level by stupid actions?*SPOILER* One scene where this chick comes out of the house and suddenly sees that mad dog. What does she do? Does she go back into the house just two meters behind her or do she run down to the storage or whatever it is longer down the hill? As stupid as she is, she goes for the longer stretch. *END OF SPOILER*I'm almost speechless, you actually laugh at how bad it is.

"Cabin Fever"......well, it was ok because it went back to the old days of horror movies where everybody died and there where no heros....but it wasn't ok because there was no plot what so ever. They never gave you a history of the virus or the town. They told you why the people in the town weren't dieing and why the kid on the porch at the store was crazy? Anybody understand that? Ok horror movie,lots of blood and death....but terrible......terrible plot.Mike

I didn't know much about this movie, but I love new horror so I watched it. Sure, it borrows a lot from classic horror flicks, but Eli Roth mixes it together in a unique blend. I was really surprised at how much I enjoyed it. Just the right mix of all the things that make horror fun.

My god this movie was really bad! The only reason I watched it through was my fascination with the boy meets world co-star. I guess I was fortunate to see some good horror in my time because this was not scary and it didn't even have a decent plot. Oh well guess we'll all be seeing it on late night t.v. soon enough.

This film in my eyes when I watched the first time I was ticked about wasting time on it. I went back and forth form liking it to hating it and back and forth. For me that was the rise and fall of it what's worse is when I got done with the movie in the first place and I knew I didn't like it I wasn't positive on all the reasons why. Then in an effort to either to understand why I didn't like it or try to like it I watched it a couple more times. Now I can tolerate it, but I have some serious issues with it.This movie seemed like the kind of film that wanted to strike a cord with us that this could really happen. But the film is bogged down by moments of unrealism or drastic stupidity on the part of the characters in the film. The gore and the subject matter were great and not ever really explored in the film and the paranoia in the film is almost indicative of "The Thing" and for some of the smarter characters you genuinely feel sorry for all the stuff that they go though but for those good things there was a bunch of things which brought the film down for me.The biggest of it is that the characters are stupid and the main characters only together seem to have a full brain between them. They seem to do the dumbest crap in trying to survive this or cope with this, why I can only speculate. Examples are this (spoiler alert); if there is a flesh eating virus would you shave your legs? No one would this was added just to add gore, I like gore but not for stupid reasons or the sake of adding it. If there's a flesh eating virus around and you find a body rotting in a lake would you climb down a splintering ladder to get a closer look? I would have accepted the idea he got the disease randomly better then this, until this moment I thought this character was smart and worth surviving. If you have a flesh eating virus would you AIM for people to vomit contaminated blood on? And NO DOCTOR in any hospital (I would have bought a local doctor), have let a contaminated patient to be gotten rid of, EVERYONE in the medical field knows about the CDC. Those are just some of the examples of unrealistic stupidity, or things done for stupid reasons for the sake of other reasons. Some stuff was just too stupid for thought; "Pancakes!", Harmonica (stupid, unrealistic and sadly done to make us laugh during a truly messed up (in an almost cool way) scene.I wasn't sure if I was watching a horror, comedy or spoof; but it didn't balance in the slightest. The only reason I give this a 4 is for the subject, gore and cool partsand I final thought on it, I wonder if Jordan Ladd was the only character with a brain and never got to use it, because the characters seemed doomed from the start. Worth a watch but it's on TV or it will be; great gore and cool subject try and enjoy :)

I thought it was going to be a gore fest, with the usual silly supernatural junk, but instead it had no supernatural nonsense at all, and was a disturbing horror movie in the old time vintage. I enjoyed it, and what I think is the killer touch, is the "rotten fruit" stuff on the DVD -- if you haven't seen that, you gotta get the DVD and see the rotten fruit stuff -- it ROCKS

I thought it was going to be a gore fest, with the usual silly supernatural junk, but instead it had no supernatural nonsense at all, and was a disturbing horror movie in the old time vintage. I enjoyed it, and what I think is the killer touch, is the  "rotten fruit" stuff on the DVD -- if you haven't seen that, you gotta get the DVD and see the rotten fruit stuff -- it ROCKS

Review title: Gore, lust, stupidity - every addle brain's desire.
Review_body: In my opinion, this movie was the most senseless and chaotic piece of work I have ever seen. The script was unimaginative and pointless, and the insertion of the occasional porno scenes only served to make this movie worse. The movie rating system is really lacks something to be desired, and I am getting tired of renting movies that don't mention nudity in the ratings for my family to watch only to find that it is a sex fest and a waste of money. I couldn't tell if the movie was about porn, diseases, or how people in backwoods small towns are morons. Adding nudity and sex scenes to a movie implies that the writer has no imagination or adequate intelligence to write a complete script. I was so bored with the movie that I fast forwarded through most of it just to get to the end to see who would survive. The only part of the movie that I did find somewhat entertaining was the gore. I would compare this movie as similar to the movie 28 days later, which was also about a plague. I suggest you pass on this movie as a complete waste of time.

This movie rocked!I was expecting another mediocre teen horror flick, something along the lines of the Texas Chainsaw Massacre remake (which over-shadowed Cabin Fever's release here in Australia), what I got was slick, in-your-face horror, that didn't take itself too seriously.Director, writer and producer, Eli Roth's directorial debut pays homage to classic horror films of the seventies and eighties; 'The Evil Dead', 'Texas Chainsaw Massacre' amongst others. His admiration of former employer David Lynch is apparent in Roth's eerie mise en' scene and kooky camera work. I have to recommend watching the film more than once, and if possible, getting your hands on the DVD version with featurette and director's commentary. Roth (who is only 32) provides a witty and entertaining insight into his warped world. Look out for the 'finger-bang misfire', 'Jake the dog' and 'the shaving' segment.Roth's script is funny in itself. The lead characters aren't particularly likeable, (who is nowadays?) but appearances from quirky minor characters make up for it. Look out for Dennis the Kung Fu kid, The partying cop and the quirky townsfolk. Also watch out for Roth who plays 'Grim' in a cool cameo. The blood and gore factor is enough to satisfy even the most seasoned horror fan - It is amazing what can be done with a bit of syrup, some KY jelly and food dye.What makes this film enjoyable, on repeat screenings, is that it becomes evident that no-one takes it too seriously. It isn't afraid to poke a little fun at itself. Horror is Roth's passion. His love, and his enthusiasm appears to rub off on the rest of the cast and crew. There is no wanky pretentiousness about it, you rent a film like 'Cabin Fever', and you aren't expecting 'art' - Roth has no illusions about this, and it's is incredibly refreshing.You won't enjoy this film if you are squeamish, or don't enjoy horror in general. It *is* violent, it *is* in you face and it sure as hell will make you cringe at least once. But if horror is your scene crack open some beers, turn the lights down and watch it with some friends. Don't try to over-analyse it, or read anything into it, just sit back and ENJOY it!(Oh... And stay out of the woods)

First off I love Eli Roth and if you are a fan of him, you are going to be a fan of this movie. Second every single actor in this movie played their characters perfectly. Phenomenal jobs! The movie has everything I love in a movie. Gags, thrills, scares, comedy, love, sacrifice, etc. The love story is what made this movie sad. I mean think about it. Your going camping to a cabin with all your best friends because you just graduated college and all of a sudden their fleshed diseased skin starts pealing off and they become outraged in killing sprees with each other. To be terrified of my best friends because I don't want to get it is one thing but to have to kill them too in exchange of them suffering from it any longer is horrifying. It was awesome in the theater and even better watching it still till' this day.

Cabin fever is about a group of college friends who rent a cabin in the middle of the woods for a week. one by one the friends starts getting a mysterious disease that eats away at their flesh! This movie isn't much of a horror but is very entertaining. There is a good amount of gore and is quite funny in places. I really enjoyed this movie and would definitely recommend watching it. i hear the second one is rubbish so i wont bother watching that! i know a lot of people hate cabin fever but i don't see why?? i think the sex scenes were pretty pointless but every film has its downfalls! I'd give this film a 9/10. i highly recommend it!!! :-)

Review title: I want those 94 minutes of my life back.
Review_body: The plot, acting, storyline and everything was terrible about this movie. There were so many distracting and nonsense events. I recommend to everyone, that you do not watch this movie. I want those 94 minutes of my life back. If I could spend a few weeks trying to find something good about this movie, I might come up with something, whether it be a sex scene or an establishing shot that was photographically pleasing. If you like simple movies, with non-complex stories, and not so good acting, and just like being scared - then sure, rent it. Otherwise, you will just be in awe as to how ridiculous this film is. I can't even watch Boy Meets World anymore now.

Review title: One of 10 worst movies I've ever seen
Review_body: No, this movie is not good. don't be fooled by anyone on this site. If I can do anyone a favor and stop them from seeing it I will have made the world a better place. The directing was terrible, and I seriously thought it was written by a 14 year old until I found out it was written by the director. There is no point to this film, and I don't mean to say I expected meaning or much merit from this genre, I mean it really had no point- it started with nothing and ended with nothing. There is no horror to speak of, no enemy, you basically wait for each character to start throwin up blood and then croak- some in more gruesome ways than others, but always without any point. The acting was fine, in that it didn't make the movie any worse. There is a high level of gratuity and "oh this would look cool" nonsense (ie the guy in the bunny suit at the hospital). Finally, the ending was insulting beyond belief. I really don't know what annoys me more, the fact that this movie was made or that people love it so much. Believe me, its bad. 1/10

me and my friend were in tears throughout this film, especially towards the end! it just kept getting better and better! this is one of the best horror-comedies i've seen. i was really surprised that it was so good, i was basically expecting another teen-actor-vessel. but this is very much old-school and definite classic material! i couldn't believe they made a movie like this in our day and age, it's comparable to golden oldies like maybe even The Thing (70s version)... or Creepshow 2's The Raft with a much better spin on it. it's kinda twisted, gross and sooo hilarious, and unlike too many horror movies, the actors here don't take themselves too seriously. lets face it, this movie is for fun-loving people who love gore, sick humor and beer!the effects are also great! my friend is a make up artist and she was also really impressed.

This film was terrible as a thriller/horror, however it served as the best comedy me and my friend had seen in a long time. We literally had to hold our laughter in at some scenes, they were just so out there and daft, when Dennis started doing karate, it was so random, and just hilarious.I lost the plot of the story midway as the silliness of a lot of it, just lost my interest. The acting was good, but the plot ruined their performance. Don't get me wrong, this maybe some peoples ''cup of tea'' and quite a few friends found the film ''entertaining'' and ''jumpy'', but most concluded like myself ''different''I would recommend you rent the film out, if your in for a bit of lighthearted horror - I promise you, you will laugh.

I consider myself to be a great fan of horror movies, past and present but this film is terrible, there are many flaws and additional comedy!!! Better for us all if they leave comedy out of horror films from now on, imagine what films will be like in years to come as there are a few horror films coming to the cinema littered with cheesy one liners and ignorant comedic performances, or so I've heard, this film is terrible I do not recommend you watch this unless you're a young spotty teenager content in watching trash and seeing female parts every 4 seconds.1/10 - utter rubbish

One of the worst movies I've ever seen. There's no such thing as a movie that could scare me; but this movie just made me laugh half of the time. You got a so-called 'horror' movie here and it's making me feel a combination of laughter/boredom/changing the channel when the commercials come up.One of the worst movies I've ever seen. There's no such thing as a movie that could scare me; but this movie just made me laugh half of the time. You got a so-called 'horror' movie here and it's making me feel a combination of laughter/boredom/changing the channel when the commercials come up.

Review title: a great film made on a tiny budget
Review_body: having watched films such as phone booth, Blair witch and cabin fever you can only come to the conclusion that the majority of good films are made with smaller budgets, this is especially true for horror films, the 70s and 80s were perfect for basic horror films with basic effect that looked raw and realistic. once u start messing around with CGI etc you lose the effect. Cabin Fever does a superb job of going back to the old school with a very minimal budget Eli Roth manages to achieve a film that is sickly disturbing with a good plot and interesting characters. just goes to show what you can do with the simple necessities: a good director, a relatively unknown cast and simple special effects, a great film well worth watching!

WoW. Usually I utter this word after witnessing one of those unforgettable movies that leave you breathless. Well this piece of work left me breathless in that I was dying for it to just end! My girlfriend and I rented this movie hoping to see a good scary movie. In the end however, all we got was an agreed notion that this was the worst movie either of us had ever seen. Oh awful movie, let me count thy ways... horrible acting, a plot line that was just plain LOST, laughable effects, bad directing, bad writing... you get the picture. My brother and I used to make home-made horror films with our friends that were more entertaining than this filth. Try Shaun of the Dead and the Evil Dead movies if you seek a good comedy-horror flick.

OK, so it maybe 5am, but this is a movie worth watching. It isn't your typical gruesome horror flick but instead a gruesome comedy full of laughs. It starts like many slasher movies, five college students off to a cabin in the woods. They start their partying and then...in enters the hermit, who turns out to have a gruesome flesh eating illness - that you guessed it - proceeds to infect the kids one by one. Instead of ending up like the usual slasher movies, Eli Roth takes you on a roller coaster of feelings from shock to laughter. You are never sure what you will be feeling or seeing (a guy in a bunny suit?) from one moment to the next. A never ending ride all the way from the start to the very end and beyond. I am still laughing!

Review title: Plenty of bloody action, but very little else.
Review_body: Very disappointing horror. A group of young men and women drive out to an isolated cabin in the woods for a bit of a break, and come across a man infected with a deadly unknown virus that turns the unfortunate infected into a murderous maniac. Alright it is a bit of a change from the usual lame brained slasher pic, but this ends up little more than a poor man's cross between "28 days later" and "The evil dead" and it's nowhere near as accomplished or effective as either of the aforementioned. There's little excitement or atmosphere generated, plenty of bloody gory sequences, but there's nothing of any real substance, and no finesse. Humour is tried for but even here it usually fails. Unsurprisingly it ends up disappointing.

Review title: One of the Worst Movies Ever!
Review_body: I stand beside my opinion that "Cabin Fever" is by far one of the most horrible excuses for cinematic entertainment since "Plan 9 from Outer Space" or "Manos: The Hands of Fate". "Why?" your active little minds may ask. I have listed my reasons below and they are threefold (directly related to my rating, too!)Reason 1: The characters. Okay, I know this movie was never meant to be Oscar caliber or even "cult flick" caliber but come on! What were they thinking? If you're unsure of what I mean here, listen to the dialog (especially that of the stoner cop who goes on for 10 minutes about partying) and above all, be able to stop the gastric up-flow that may occur when you finish the flick!Reason 2: The camera-work.I could have filmed something better when I was in diapers. They must have handed the cam to some drunkard from Nova Scotia, 'cause the cinematography was cathartic, clumsy, and above all AWFUL!(note, this is my only praise for the film) Reason 3: The old man at the store.This cat was funny, not quite as much as the story itself, but entertaining nonetheless. He provided some much-needed comic relief which was really a shame because he was only at the beginning and end of the film. So there you have it! I don't care if I ever see this movie ever again but I might have to add it to my collection just for squirts and giggles.

It's now 2 in the morning and i can't sleep due to being baffled by such a terrible movie. there is absolutely zero plot, no point or underlying theme, just tons and tons of unnecessary blood. Parts in the movie that made no sense what-so-ever.. 1.) The part where the kid sitting on the bench (Dennis) that looks like a a girl, starts screaming for pancakes then proceeds to Hung Du all the way to Bert, who then proceeds to bite his hand with no resistance from Bert at all... 2.) What was in the box that the fat inbred was carrying around? before he was brutally murdered by taking a screwdriver though the brain... 3.) Why do they insist on drinking out of the reservoir that is contaminated with God knows what, as well as some flesh eating disease? 4.) what was the deal with the random black guys at the end of the movie? 5.) how does someone not notice a chunk of skin in the bottom of the water glass before drinking it? 6.) how did the X-Games stoner die? and why is he ripped in half? 7.) where do they take "Boy Meets World kid" at the end of the movie? 8.) what was the point of the lady chopping the pig up? 9.) what was going with the naked lady in the bed when the hick told boy meets world kid to get off his property? 10.) why were the kids at the end getting water from that gross excuse of a reservoir? 11.) why did they build up a relationship with boy meets world kid and hot blonde only to have her face eaten away then her insides eaten by a dog, then getting beaten to death by boy meets world kid for about 3 minutes when all it would have taken was one hit to the face? and then later the dog's owner found in a cave torn in half?i could go on forever, but i choose not to. my point is that this is one of the worst movies i have ever seen, i feel dumber for having watched it. how can a production studio pat money for this? you know a movie is bad when it ends and you have no idea what just happened for the last hour and a half. this caused me physical pain to watch and i only hope for humanity that this movie is retrieved by everyone who owns it and promptly burned until there is nothing left. i wish i would have gone to bed instead of watch that horrible excuse of a movie. that is my rant, thank you for reading and good night, finally...

Review title: Funny, But Not At All Scary
Review_body: I'm not sure what sort of drugs and/or alcohol the person who typed up the review for this movie was on, but please, for the sake of American's everywhere, don't listen to them. This movie was not scary, at all, in any way. It was actually quite funny. They got the suspenseful music down, and stuff like that, but overall, it just made me roll on the ground with laughter. Pancakes! Other than Rider Strong (Sean Hunter from "Boy Meets World") the acting was atrocious. Definitely worth 50 cents tops, but no more of your money should be poured into this comedy-posing-as-a-horror film. If you are in the mood for a decent horror movie, then check out Texas Chainsaw Massacre, House Of 1000 Corpses, or The Devil's Rejects.

IF you loved SAW, SAW2, House of Wax, Freddy vs Jason, alone in the dark, fog(2005) etc.. then this film probably isn't for you. This film is aimed at those who like alternative horror, its a p**s-take of the current wave of absolute dire remakes and re-workings of the 'bunch of teenagers running around screaming' type. If you love the evil dead films then you'll know what to expect.The film starts out like any other teen horror film. Bunch of annoying kids going on a trip(i didn't want to watch any more at this point as i though i knew what was going to happen). As not to spoil it i won't say too much but the film takes an abrupt turn and messes around with the protagonists in all manner of insane situations. This is not a horror film it is a comedy horror. I hadn't laughed so much in ages. This is not ripping off anything, its almost a homage to Evil dead, night of the living dead and any other gore fest. It doesn't have to have a point of a reason for everything just treat it as a bit of fun.

Usual horror stuff in this one. Only really watched it because Marcy has great boobs!! But it was very good and funny. If the outback of America was like this, no one would go there! The special effects were good and the acting excellent for a low budget slasher. The plot line is a bit out there and the ending gives someone a reason to make Cabin Fever 2. And the rednecks at the end drinking the water mans that they all get infected and then spread it to their family and friends and so on and so on! This could be the next black plague when it gets out of the out back of the US and then onto the world. Doesn't take itself too serious and of course Marcy is a knockout! Pity she gets infected and ends up dying like every one else.

I saw the whole movie, and it just shown how nothing happened. Kid bit a man, but that lead nowhere. Girl got her face eaten, but that lead nowhere. Guy who didn't get infected gets shot. Infected guy infects water. Guy who dropped N-bomb is friends with random black people. The black people, by the way, are pretty much just giant stereotypes. Don't worry, they only appear for five seconds just for a joke. In short, people get flesh eating virus, they die. End of story. Everybody go home.

Cabin fever is one of the worst movies I've seen. For a start, the acting is no good, unreal, without attitude and so bad it's not even funny. The story comes without structure, totally predictable, the writing is very unnatural, the characters act in a very incoherent way, there's a lot of make-up involved pretending to gross out the audience but that can't save a bad movie. Like always, there are some good things: like the weirdness of characters or some scenes that are unexplainable but funny. But 2 or 3 good elements can't help 100 mistakes. I think Cabin Fever wants to be a bizarre horror movie, but it's not bizarre, just stupid. Nudity, sex, violence, blood and diseases, the magic ingredients for a boring movie....oh! and don't forget the furious dog, that's the climax. I read other comments of people who found it great; I respect all opinions, but, my advise, you'll get more fun, learn more and have a better time taking the fleas of your dog... trust me.

I actually found Cabin Fever quite amusing after I realised it wasn't going to be a scary horror movie. I guess it is occasionally frightening, in that way you expect from this genre, in semi-darkened scenes with that eerie music. It does remind me of the "Evil Dead" movies in terms of over-the-top gore, but I was still hoping for more of that somehow. Similar premise to the first Evil Dead movie too, in a way - a bunch of college kids go stay in a cabin in the woods somewhere remote and bad stuff begins to happen.I was expecting to be blown away by it and so was initially disappointed, but on coming back to it - to particular amusing scenes - I get dragged back into watching it, it's somehow very addictive. I've forced a few people to watch a couple of my favourite parts of this movie, and they've generally cringed and laughed and probably wondered what the attraction is... It is very stupid at times, but that's becoming a plus for me.I really like the occasional random stuff and the strange dialogue at times. The characters might not have been very well developed, but they work well enough for me in this film. And there are moments of shocking gore, which is really what I was after in the first place. It seems to have been very well made - well much greater quality than Evil Dead #1 and Bad Taste - which was all I was hoping for. I'd give it 6.5 if I could.

although this film had gory scenes it still remained that it was another pointless attempt to gross people out and have a bit of sex in it the plot was very very thin... the actors didn't light up the screen and i found myself praying for the next one to die... i feel asleep twice through sheer boredom and even after the third time watching it failed 2 see the significance of film it seemed like yet another long winded pointless horror that wasn't scary and looked more like a comedy with the added bonus of some blood and gore... i wouldn't recommend this film 2 anyone who want a good time, i think you'll find its quite annoying really

This is a great ribald comedy / horror flic in the tradition of Evil Dead ( which was itself misunderstood when it first came out ). You pretty much despise all the characters the moment you set eyes on them. They're there for the directors disposal ( literally and otherwise ! ) in various gruesome but funny scenes one after the other. In some ways it is more subversive than Evil Dead in that we are almost on the side of the flesh eating virus and the locals. Po-faced critics attack scenes as "ridiculous" or "that undercut the horror" - it's obvious that they don't get it what this film's about ! The movie is almost worth seeing for a joke which starts at the beginning of the movie but whose pay off we see only at the end - and it's a classic ! If people are still watching with a straight face by the end of this film then ... well, there is no hope for them !

WOW!!  My husband and I had no idea that this was one of those horrible B-movies where you feel like slitting your wrists just to end the awfulness!!  This is one of those movies never stops being stupid and ridiculous!!  We had read the plot outline here on imdb.com and saw the trailers and thought "Hmmm, ok.  It looks like it has potential"  Boy, were we wrong!!  The only thing that was horrific in this movie was the acting, misuse of "scary music", dialogue and story line.  We went to a drive-in theater to see this movie hoping that we would jump out of our seats, bite our nails and maybe let out a few screams...however, we ended up watching the other movies around us.  Oddly enough, Dickie Roberts was more entertaining.  Our advice to you:  Sneak in!  Save yourself a few dollars and hope and pray that the film industry NEVER EVER makes another movie like this.  And I'm curious if they will add this story line to Scary Movie 5?? Now that's more like it!!
Unfortunately I went in thinking that this movie was going to be scary.. I was GROSSly misinformed.Some of this was grostesque, but other parts of the movie were actually really humorous.

Review title: This movie makes me want to puke and then puke again.
Review_body: When I saw the previews for this movie, I didn't expect much to begin with - around a second rate teen horror movie. But wow, this movie was absolutely awful. And that's being generous.First of all, the casting for the movie was terrible. You feel no sympathy (or for that matter any morbid feeling) for the characters. The acting was so terrible that I was just simply waiting and hoping for the God-awful thing to end.Secondly, there are points in the movie that had absolutely no relation to the plot whatsoever.
