I wouldn't recommend anyone watch this film - unless I knew them well enough to know they wouldn't want to harm me for making them waste 90 minutes of their life. But I love it, because it's just SO BAD. In fact, if they made it better in any way at all, I would have just been bored. So, don't watch Cabin Fever. And if you do, make sure your expectations are very low, and you don't have something you could be doing for the length of the film - you'll only wish you'd been doing it.

When i first picked up this film i definitely wasn't expecting what i got, from what other people have told me and the words 'TERRIFYING' on the front cover.Though it is one of THE worst horror movies i have ever seen, it was surprisingly funny(Apart from the annoying brunette who decided after nearly all her friends had died that it was the right time to shave her legs, because you know a girls gotta look good) Funniest moment was def. Dennis (Creepy Boy who looks like a girl) with the whole pancakes panCAKES PANCAKES !And then the little matrix routine before he decided that what he had just tucked into wasn't actually a gigantic pancake.Also Paul (One of the main characters) who started off as a normal pathetic young man and ended up as a person who enjoyed poking dead bodies with sticks,turning them over,looking disgusted and then hitting them over the head with a shovel of some sort.Would recommend if you have an odd sense of humour.

Review title: Dreadful - Why was this film unleashed on good people?!?
Review_body: I really don't know where to begin. I had wanted to see this film for ages before I actually saw it as I am a horror film freak & am really into the contemporary teen slasher films, you know, Wrong Turn, Texas Chainsaw Massacre, etc, (as well as more traditional horror movies! Can't beat The Fog, The Haunting, The Wicker Man, & all those other amazing films!). So, my expectations were high....Words cannot describe how crap this film is, they really can't. The plot is terrible, atrocious acting, lacking in any kind of resolution or conclusion at the end, just plain b****cks. I remember sitting there watching it, thinking I was watching a film that was made purely as a joke. I couldn't believe that somebody actually thought it was a good idea & a good result. When it was over, I was expecting the film to suddenly start again, with a "proper" story, & that what I'd just seen would prove to have been one big nasty trick & I would soon be presented with the "real" thing. Realising it was indeed over, I thought "What the hell did I do to deserve that?" Please, I beg, do not waste your time or your money on this pile of dog turd. In fact, I do urge all people to see it just so they can grasp how bad it is!

Truly one of the most dire films I've ever sat through. I've never actually taken the time to write one of these but felt compelled to after witnessing this affront to film-making and feel somewhat aggrieved to be wasting my time on such a piece of turd to be honest. There were so many parts that infuriated me with their complete randomness and lack of sense (e.g. when would the police force ever shoot people with infectious diseases? When would hospitals ever through out such people for lack of a cure? Why was the guy who spotted him spying on his wife wandering around outside in his dressing gown whilst carrying a gun as she rolled around on the bed?). Also, the characterisation - as we've almost come to expect in such films - was awful (e.g. the way the blonde guy - I don't remember his frickin name and don't give a toss anyway - completely turned against his girlfriend and ran off to leave her) and I ended up wanting them all to meet grisly ends! The production was horribly disjointed and the cinematography nothing to write home about.

Review title: Eli Roth...you are NOT Sam Raimi!
Review_body: This is one of the few movies that made me want my $7 back.I'm not some cynical film snob who always tears apart movies. I just expect to be entertained when I go to a movie. And especially, I expect to be scared, or at least grossed-out, when I see a horror movie.Sure, the actors weren't so great and it looked cheap, but it's a low-budget, B horror movie, so those are easily understandable.What I really, absolutely HATE about this movie is how much better it might've been if Eli Roth had suddenly decided he was going to remake "Evil Dead 2." Unlike Sam Raimi (the director of "Evil Dead 2," but I'm sure most you reading this already know that), Eli Roth CANNOT interject comedy into his work and still maintain the suspense and dread of a good horror film. In fact, most every single scene that might've actually been legitimately scary was completely marred by Roth's schlock attempts at comic relief. Every time, it was a complete mood killer and felt totally out of place.And the absolute worst part, the part that actually made me turn to my date (and her towards me) in the theatre and say, "What the F*CK!?!?!?" was the ending when the redneck store owner (who you think for a minute is about to shoot a couple of black people who've come into his store), suddenly starts pounding fists with them and talking in ebonics. Even remembering it makes me say, "What the F*CK!?!?!?" Do yourself a favor and just rent "Evil Dead 2" and skip this pale (and I mean ghost-white pale) imitation. Make those 2 hours actually be good for something.
Why is the cast info for this all wrong? Same on Google. Matthew Dedarrio isn't even listed and he plays Jeff.

I bought this movie, I remembered the trailer and thought it was going to be a really good movie. It looked like it was going to be really scary.In my opinion, it really wasn't that good a movie. They used a lot of foul language that served no purpose whatsoever, and the gratuitous scenes were pointless, with no connection to the plot at all.It was gory and disgusting, and not really scary. I mean, the idea of getting a disease like that was scary, but the way they played the characters, they were just so unlikable that you couldn't get scared because you didn't like any of them really.I think this movie is worth it if you can catch it on TV, or if it's on HBO and you already pay for it, but to rent or buy it, I don't really think it was worth the money.
If you don't like this movie your dumb...prove me wrong

Review title: Not very good. Bad writing. Bad Directing. Bad Acting (by the guys).
Review_body: OK, so I just saw this movie on cable tonight Feb. 16, 2006 and I have to say it was pretty bad.In fact the only reason I watched it and kept watching it was because it had two good looking girls in it. After they were dead I had no interest to further watch the rest of the movie -even though I did because nothing else was on TV at the moment.It also kept dragging on when it should have ended and it contained some strange scenes that didn't make any sense to the story but yet someone felt they should be in the final cut for humor.That's bad film-making, leave your 'little darlings' on the cutting table, or in modern terms on the hard drive. Include the nonsensical crap on the DVD for the 'dropped scenes' or the 'Directors cut' or whatever the hell you want to call it, but keep them out of the story.Yes I'm talking about the weirdo kung fu monkey kid who repeatedly screamed 'pan cakes!!!' and bit bad actor #1's fingers. The writing was bad, predictable and stale.Obviously this thing had a micro budget or no budget so the writer had to make do with basically nothing but the single location (the cabin) and the out doors. Even still there are great movies that take place in basically one location but of course they had good writers and good actors.I also don't know why this movie had an R rating, I was really disappointed with it, it should have been PG 13.The male leads acted too much like stereotypical morons and they did a fairly poor job of it, none of them showed any decent acting ability except maybe the guy who played the 'wuss', and he just so so but that could have been bad writing as well.Whether this was due to bad directing or just bad acting is hard to say and us viewers don't really care who's to blame.The two lead girls did a respectable job, especially the cute blond ( even though she didn't get naked which of course every guy wants to see ) .It was pretty retarded (for lack of a better term) that the girls die so early in the movie and it would have been nice if one of the girls (I prefer the blond) had survived.No one cares if wussy boy in the stream is alive (or dead).The filmmakers obviously wanted to keep the door open for a possible sequel in the event this thing made some money.Best thing about this movie:The casting of the two girls, especially the blond.The next best thing about this movie:Nothing.Recommendation:If you're under 18 and it comes on cable you MIGHT enjoy it, but more likely you'll just be disappointed when the girls don't really show much and nothing interesting happens.If you feel like discussing any of these comments or this movie please email me at Yahoo.com. (My IMDb posted username @ yahoo.com) .

I heard horrible reviews about Cabin Fever, but since I love "bad" horror movies I borrowed it from a friend and I'm so glad I did! It's a brilliant, hilarious, gory, ridiculous, fun, scary ride.Some of my favorite high points: *Pancakes! The slow motion tae kwon do was awesome.*Paul (Shawn Hunter!)going all nuts and beating Karen to death. He must like poking bodies with sticks (like the body in the water as he clung off the obviously rotten ladder).*What's in the box?!? *Deputy Party Man *Leg shaving scene (sooo gnarly) followed by "eaten-by-dogs" scene.Genius! I can't wait to see it again!

'Cabin Fever' is possibly the worst horror film made in over a decade.Apparently the director, Eli Roth, has worked with David Lynch but I suspect he was merely cleaning the great man's pool as he displays no sign of talent whatsoever.Ripping off huge chunks of 'The Texas Chainsaw Massacre', 'The Evil Dead' and John Carpenter's 'The Thing' Roth shows some taste in his source material but no knowledge of how to put these elements together.Five - yes, five - supposedly 'sexy' but actually geeky young people go into the woods for some sex or something. Approached by a tramp with a sub-X-Files looking disease they set him on fire for some reason - but not before one of their own number is contaminated. Thereafter there's a lot of shouting, the worst bit of Kung Fu you can imagine and attempts at humour that fall like a horse down a lift-shaft. At one point one of the girls decides to take a bath and shave her legs despite having a skin rotting disease as if someone has just reminded Roth that he has promised the audience some tits but had not yet delivered.The effects are shoddy, the 'acting' atrocious and the attempts at tasteless merely puerile. In the Director's commentary - one of 4 commentary tracks on the DVD - Roth repeatedly describes other directors as pussies and boasts of his own achievements like a cross between Quentin Tarantino and David Brent.Imagine 'Porky's' or 'Sex Lives of the Potato Men' with fake-looking gore and you will still be overestimating this garbage.It's embarrassing beyond belief.
